title: John's 68 Camaro
story: John's Mother special ordered the car new in 1968 and his Grandmother had signed the loan papers at the time. Shortly after the Camaro was delivered to the house John's Grandmother passed away and the insurance had paid off the loan (only one or two payments were made). The Camaro was driven daily and John remembers sitting on his parents lap behind the wheel. Jerry's Hot Rods performed the body restoration.
caption1: When picked up - In need of a TOTAL RESTORATION
caption2: Metal work; Body & Paint by Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Charlie's 67 Z/28 (1 of 602 Produced)
story: This original 1967 Z/28 (1 of 602 produced) was drag raced most of its life only showing 14000 miles on the odometer. The car went thru a total restoration with Lucas Restoration and Jerry's Hot Rods. This Camaro scored 99.5% percent in a 5000 point legend judging at the Camaro Nationals in June 2014. Charlie sent the Camaro back to Jerry's Hot Rod to Perform the final things to make the car 100%.
caption1: Charlie's 1967 Z/28
caption2: Charlie's car like it was delivered to Yenko Chevrolet only 47 Years Later

title: Nancy's 68 Z/28
story: Jerry's Hot Rods completely stripped the paint and restored it back to new
caption1: Stripping the paint on nancy's z
caption2: Body and paint by Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Dave's 1969 Z/28 Camaro
story: The sub frame was removed & engine rebuilt. The engine compartment was cleaned then painted and detailed before reassemble then certified by Jerrry MacNeish of Camaro Hi-performance
caption1: Complete engine compartment detail
caption2: Sub Frame being installed

title: Phil's 67 Camaro
caption1: Body work done and first coat of primer applied
caption2: Body and Paint by Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Jay's 68 SS/RS Camaro
story: After Jay bought the car he sent it to Lucas Restorations to have a few things done.The car was inspected and a lot of hidden damage was revealed. Jerry's Hot Rods replaced the complete front and trunk floors. The left quarter panel & tail light panel we also replaced.
caption1: As arrived to Jerry's Hot Rods
caption2: Installed Floors - Tail Light Panel - Quarter Panel.

title: Kathy's 66 Pony
story: Kathy's is having a great time riding her Little Pony around. When she is in the saddle she is 21 Again

title: Jerry's 34 Dodge Street Rod
story: Jerry's chopped 1934 Dodge with Dodge drivetrain and Air Ride Suspension. Complete car built at Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Marks 69 Z/28
story: Mark shipped his car from DelMar Ca. to Jerry's Hot Rods to have his Z/28 restored.The original owner (Jack) was there to check the car out also.  Marks Z/28 score 98% in the Bow Tie Judging at the Camaro Nat. in 2012 and is qualified for the Legend Judging

story: 34 Dodge Coupe 440 Six Pack
caption1: Complete build by Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Dave's 31 Ford Coupe
story: Dave's car had only been painted a year when he decided to get the roof chopped. The car was covered and the roof was chopped so only the top need to be painted.
caption1: Chopping the roof on Dave's 31 Ford Coupe
caption2: Dave's coupe chopped and rewired

title: Bob's 390 AMX
story: Bob and his son-in-law Adam pulled the engine and trans out of the car then sent the car to Jerry's Hot Rods for a total restoration. While we were performing our magic Bob was locating and gathering all the correct parts to make the car as perfect as possible. We reassembled the complete car.  Bob picked his AMX up from our shop and drove back to New York.
caption1: As delivered to shop
caption2: A complete rotisserie restoration by Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Tania's 68 Camaro Eleanor
story: Tania's father LIno got the car for free then pulled it apart and sent it to Jerry's Hot Rods for the body restoration. They are in the process of installing a new LS 2 motor and 5 Speed. Tania liked the Eleanor car from the movie Gone in 60 Seconds so we painted and striped the car the same.
caption1: As received at shop
caption2: Body and Paint restored by Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Frank's 68 Camaro 396/375HP
story: Frank found this car with the back end sticking out of a barn. He got Jerry MacNeish of Camaro Hi-performance to verify the original drive train. Camaro Hi-performance rebuilt the engine and trans. They also rebuilt the rear. Ken Lucas located and restored parts while Jerry's Hot Rods restored the body.
caption1: As delivered to shop
caption2: After complete body rotisserie restoration at Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Alan's 1969 Pace Car
story: Alan had been driving his pace car but it needed some TLC so Jerry's Hot Rods repainted his car correctly and repaired the issue that he had.
caption1: Alan had Jerry's Hot Rods repaint his 69 pace car
caption2: After Jerry's Hot Rods repaint the car with correct orange strips

title: Gabe's 65 Chevy II
story: Gabe is reassembling the car and installing a LS3 motor
caption1: As delivered to shop
caption2: After body and paint at Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Jerry MacNeish's 65 SS 396 4 speed convertible
story: The engine and transmission along with seats and door panels were removed when the car was sent to Jerry's Hot Rods to have a total frame off restoration. Jerry MacNeish rebuilt the complete drive train while also locating and restoring parts for the car. Jerry's Hot Rods restored the body and frame then reassembled the car to better thrn New Condition. The build sheet was found inside one seat documenting it's options. This car was presented at SEMA 2014 in the GM booth.
caption1: Jerry rescued the car from sitting in a quonset hut for years
caption2: After a complete nut and bolt frame off restoration

title: Guy's 69 Z/28 Rally Sport JL8 Camaro
story: Guy's camaro was featured in a 80s Hot Rod Magazine showing the RARE 4 Wheel Disk Brakes.
caption1: As droppped off at shop
caption2: All the body and paint was done with the stripes in the correct position. Installed the rally sport grill and headlight.

title: Scott's 69 Z/28
story: Scott's father bought the Z/28 in the early 70s then passed the car down to Scott. Scott dissassembled the car and gathered parts. Then Jerry's Hot Rod's restored the body and paint. We installed the subframe with the motor and trans alongside all the sheet metal; then applied the stripes. Scott took the car back home and finished the assembly. Scotts scored 98% in the 2014 Bow Tie class at the Camaro Nationals and is planning to run it thru the Ledgens Class next year.
caption1: As delivered to shop
caption2: At The Camaro Nationals 2014

title: Bruce's 67 Camaro Pace Car: 1 of 560 Produced
story: Bruce is the orignal owner of this 67 Pace car. The car was purchased in July of 67 and he still has it today. The pace car sat in storage for 14 years before he got Jerry's Hot Rods to restore the body and paint. Bruce's Car was featured on the cover of Chevy Classics Magazine with a 4 page article.
caption1: After 14 years of storage
caption2: 47 years later and back to the way it looked when he bought it.

title: Bob's 1969 Camaro Z/11 Pace Car
story: Bob's Pace Car was sitting idle at another shop. He then sent the project to Jerry's Hot Rods to get finished. Power top - Factory A/C - power windows - and a four speaker blue light stereo was added. After 20 some years Bob is driving his Pace Car again.
caption1: As dropped off to Jerry's Hot Rods
caption2: Completed turn key restoration from Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Mike's 55 Chevy Belair 2 door Hardtop
story: Mike has owned his 55 Chevy since 1969. After being off the road for 18 years he got Jerry's Hot Rods to do a complete restoration on the body. Mike dropped off his frame with the drive train installed. We installed the body to the frame then installed all the sheet metal. Mike completed the assemble and is now driving his car once again.
caption1: As dropped off to Jerry's Hot Rods
caption2: Complete body and paint by Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Sandy's 1969 Camaro Z/28
story: Sandy is the second owner of her 69 Z/28 having bought it in December of 1969 as a used car. The car was used for some road coarse racing in the 70s as well as a daily driver. Jerry's Hot Rods restored the Z/28 back to the day she bought it and she is driving it once again.
caption1: Sandy's Z/28 After being completely disassembled and ready for media blasting
caption2: Sandy's 69 Z/28 restored back to day one

title: John's 1969 Camaro Z/28
story: John wanted his Z/28 to score as well as it could in the Ledgen Judging at the Camaro Nationals so a list was made and Jerry's Hot Rods completed all the improvements scoring a 94.5 in the Ledgens Judging.
caption1: John bought a done 1969 Z/28 and had Jerry's Hot Rods disassemble the car to make some improvements
caption2: John's 1969 Z/28 completed

title: 1968 Camaro Custom
story: Complete new floor from fire wall to tail light panel. Mini tubbed with a narrowed rear. Ride Tech Triangulated four link rear suspension installed with Shock Wave Air Bags. TCI front sub frame with power rack installed. Stayfast cloth top with glass window.
caption1: Back from Media Blasting
caption2: Pro Touring Convertible

caption1: Orignal 1959 Impala Dash modiftyed to fit 68 Camaro
caption2: TCI Front Subframe LS1 -4L60E

title: Dave's 1969 Camaro Rally Sport
caption1: Body stripped to bare metal
caption2: Dave's Rally Sport completely restored

title: Mike Strickler's "﻿Old Reliable" ﻿Tribute Car to his Dad
story: Mike Strickler - son of Famous Drag Racing Legend Dave Strickler - built this car (onced owned by his father Dave) as a tribute to his fathers racing  history. Mike plans to race his new "OLD RELIABLE" Ammon R. Smith 67 Camaro SS in a nostalgic drag racing class.
caption1: As arrived at Jerry's Hot Rods
caption2: Body and Paint by Jerry's Hot Rods. Hand Lettering by Spangler Signs.

story: Featured in Popular Hot Rodding Magazine

caption2: Fred's AMX With an LT4 Engine And 700R Trans

story: Bobby's Chevy II has a 350 engine in front of a Muncie Four Speed over a Rack & Pinion Steering and sitting on Air Ride Suspension
caption1: Bobby's 66 Chevy II as dropped off
caption2: Body & Paint by Jerry's Hot Rods. Assembled by Bobby.

title: Dale's 69 Z28
story: Congratulations to Dale for scoring 94.7% (4737 points in a 5000 point judging) at The Camaro Natonals
caption1: Dale's 69 Z28 back from Media Blasting
caption2: Dale's Z Body& Paint by Jerry's Hot Rods. Assembled by Dale.

title: ET 68 Camaro Convertible
caption1: Pictured as received when pulled from previous restoration shop
caption2: Body & Paint by Jerry's Hot Rods. Restoration Assembly by Lucas Restorations.

title: Bill's 36 Dodge Street Rod
story: Bill bought this 36 Dodge for $500.00. It was sitting in a barn that had caught fire. The fire department pulled the car out but all the glass- lead and interior was gone. After looking at the car Bill's son thought his father had lost his MIND. Together we built the car of his dreams. Featured in Hemmings Motor News.
caption1: Bill's 36 Dodge
caption2: Jerry installed independent front suspension with rack and pinion steering. Fuel injected motor with overdrive transmission from a 96 dodge van. Filled the roof - shaved the door handles and trim - Body & Paint.

title: Joe's 29 Model A Chop Top
caption1: Joe's 29 Ford Paint is being protected so the roof could be chopped and only the top would require re-painting
caption2: Joe's 29 after roof chopped and Visor installed

title: Paul's 69 427 COPO
story: Paul is the second owner of this COPO Camaro and has owned it since 1972. Paul had the camaro running a 10.80 in 1973 at the drag strip and was one of the well respected cars at the local cruise spots.  The car has all the orginal sheet metal with no rust. The orginal motor and 4 speed are being rebuilt to finish the restoration. Look for it at The Camaro Nationals in the future.
caption1: Paul's 69 COPO after media blasting
caption2: COPO Body painted and assembled Waiting for Wendy to install the drivetrain as well as the interior to finish the Restoration

title: Bob's 69 SS/RS 396 - 375 HP Camaro
caption1: Bob's 69 SS/RS 396 Quarters and Roof Removed
caption2: Body and paint done waiting for Bob to assemble

title: Rob's 70 Road Runner
story: After all the rust was removed and new panels welded into place the complete car was painted the original body color as Plymouth did when it was new.
caption1: 70 Road Runner Trunk Floor Removed
caption2: Floor painted body color

story: Rob completely gutted the car then had Jerry's Hot Rods replace the rusted floors and quarter panels. The body was subjected to a complete Rotiserie Restoration to remove any flaws and then was painted. Rob had the orginal 383 engine and 727 trans rebuilt. He restored the a/c heater box. The front and rear suspension were also restored.
caption1: Rob's 70 Road Runner
caption2: Complete Body Rotisserie Restoration by Jerry's Hot Rods then car was reassembled by Rob the Owner

title: John's 39 Ford Street Rod 502 Ram Jet
caption1: John's 39 Ford
caption2: Body and Paint by Jerry's Hot Rods. Assembled by John

title: Frank's 66 Charger
story: Frank fell in love with a 66 Charger when he was a teenager. In the late 70s he bought this one and performed a total restoration but painted it with lacquer. After some time the paint started sinking as well as flaking off. Frank had Jerry's Hot Rods took the complete car down to metal and then used modern paint material to bring the car to todays standards. Frank spent a lot of time reconditioning all the parts and has reassembeled the complete car.
caption1: Filler is used to make the body look perfect
caption2: Body is painted in acrylic urethane base/ clear by Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Diane & Gene's 67 Camaro
story: Gene & Diane are working on the reassembly of there Camaro.
caption1: Diane is cleaning out the body after it came back from Media Blasting
caption2: Body & paint by Jerry's Hot Rods. Waiting for Diane and Gene to assemble.

title: Vernon's 54 Ford Sunliner Convertible
story: Vernon's first car was a 1954 Ford Convertible and now that he nears retirement he wanted another one. After buying this one he had Jerry at Jerry's Hot Rods remove all the stainless and chrome so it could be restored and then perform his Magic on the body.
caption1: Chrome and stainless removed - ready for paint removal
caption2: Watch your eyes - this baby will blind you! Body & Paint by Jerry's Hot Rods

title: Fred's 79 AMX Spirit
story: LS 6 Fuel Injected Motor. Installed custom front spoiler. Featured in Popular Hot Rodding Magazine.
caption1: Fred's AMX back from Media Blasting
caption2: Candy Apple Red Paint & Body by Jerry's Hot Rods.

title: John's 68 Fairlane 428 CJ
story: John had the 428 rebuilt. He restored the suspension and installed it. He is looking forward to driving his Cobra Jet in the near future.

caption2: Body & Paint by Jerry's Hot Rods ready for sanding and buffing
